title: 108_s2233
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Research Enhancement Act". It pertains to Environmental Protection Agency research activities. The Environmental Research, Development, and Demonstration Authorization Act of 1979 is amended to establish the position of Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency. The Deputy Administrator will be appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate. The President considers recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences, National Academy of Engineering, and Science Advisory Board for appointments. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees the Agency's Office of Research and Development and Office of Environmental. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees the Agency's Office of Research and Development, Office of Environmental Information, Science Advisory Board, Science Policy Council, and scientific and technical activities in regulatory program and regional offices. They are responsible for identifying important scientific issues facing the Agency. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees the Agency's scientific activities, including developing strategies for acquiring and disseminating scientific information, ensuring scientific outreach needs are met, and addressing important scientific issues within major policy proposals. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees scientific activities, including coordinating quality-assurance and peer-review activities Agency-wide. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees scientific activities, including ensuring appropriate scientific information is used in decision-making at all levels in the Agency and certifying the validity and appropriate application of scientific and technical information in regulatory decisions and policies. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development of the Agency shall be appointed for a term of 6 years, applicable to appointments made after the enactment of this subsection. The head of the Office, in consultation with advisory boards, shall establish a program for senior research appointments in Office of Research and Development Laboratories. The Office of Research and Development, in consultation with advisory boards, will recruit senior researchers with distinguished achievements in environmental research. The head of the Office will provide awards to support research in advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and to train junior researchers with exceptional promise. The Office of Research and Development will establish selection procedures for award recipients, with awards lasting 5 years and renewable. Each laboratory will have at least one senior researcher appointed under the program. Authorization of necessary appropriations is provided. The Office of Research and Development will maintain a balance between core and problem-driven research, empower research managers to make decisions, and authorize necessary appropriations for its activities. The Office of Research and Development aims to maintain a balance between core and problem-driven research, implement a strategy to acquire and apply research results from various sources, and enhance transparency in decision-making processes. The Administrator of the Agency is responsible for increasing efforts to disseminate research products, explain their significance, and assist others in applying the results. This includes directing the Deputy Administrator for assistance priorities, assignments, and fund allocation. The Administrator is responsible for disseminating research products and assisting in their application. The Deputy Administrator is directed to expand the science inventory of the Agency to include project details and resource allocations. The Deputy Administrator is tasked with expanding the science inventory of the Agency, including project details and resource allocations. This involves coordinating activities through the Agency-wide science planning and budgeting process, ensuring proper peer review, and implementing a peer-review policy to enhance independence. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is renamed as "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency." Any references to the Deputy Administrator in laws or records will now refer to the Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management. Section 5314 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to reflect this change. The Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is renamed as "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency" at Executive Schedule Level III.
